print.simulation

Class Random

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Random
      • print.simulation.Random
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Random
extends java.util.Random
    Random.java A class that generates random double values using either the Gaussian or Poisson distributions. 
        Project: print.simulation
    Platform: jdk 1.6.0_14; NetBeans IDE 6.8; Mac OSx
    Course: CS 143
    Hours: 2 hours
    Created on May 25th, 2013, 10:00:00 PM
    See Also:
    PrintSimulationGUI, Client, Server, Queue, ListNode, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double mean
      Mean around which the distributions will operate.
      private double standardDeviation
      Standard Deviation around which the distributions will be generated, using the mean as a pivot point.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Random(double mean)
      Constructor: sets both the mean and standard deviation as the passed value.
      Random(double mean, double standardDeviation)
      Constructor: sets the mean and standard deviation as the two separate passed values.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns an int value that is exponentially distributed around the mean.

      Returns a double value that is exponentially distributed around the mean.

      • Random

        public Random(double mean)

        mean - double mean around which the distributions will be centered

      • Random

        public Random(double mean,
      double standardDeviation)
        Constructor: sets the mean and standard deviation as the two separate passed values.
        Parameters:
        mean - double value around which the distributions will be centered
        standardDeviation - double value representing where percentages of the randomly generated values will fall around the mean.
        See Also:
        nextGaussian(), mean, standardDeviation
